ReportSection.name: Quiz
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 1
ReportSection.Static: Now that you’ve learned about the benefits of optimizing your medication and why it’s important for your healthy lifestyle plan, let's review and see how much you remember.
ReportSection.ReportItem:
During an annual medication review, I don’t need to bring up the over the counter medications or vitamins I take.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer1
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 1
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item} The truth is, all forms of medications, prescribed or otherwise can have negative interaction effects.

Over the counter medications and other supplements can also cause side effects, interact with prescription medications and impact the health outcomes we hope to achieve with prescription medications.

ReportSection.name: Quiz2
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 2
ReportSection.ReportItem:
If I think my medication is giving me unwanted side effects, I should stop taking it.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer2
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 2
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item} The truth is, you should always talk to your healthcare provider before making any changes.

You should always inform your healthcare provider of any side effects you might experience. This is why tracking your medications is important, so you can track symptoms that might develop and when you started experiencing a symptom.

Although your doctor might decide that stopping your medication is the correct approach, you should always talk to them first and follow their advice on how to safely stop the medication.

ReportSection.name: Quiz3
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 3
ReportSection.ReportItem:
It’s normal to feel unwell when we take many kinds of medication.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Answer3
ReportSection.title: QUESTION 3
ReportSection.ReportItem:
{$item} The truth is, you should talk to your healthcare provider about any side effects you might have.

Although medications might have some adverse effects, it is always worth discussing the challenges you are facing with your healthcare provider. They will know if it’s possible to address your side effects by optimizing your medication and what steps to take.
